result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen Antone Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: in lieu of $443 costs; Consecutive to 51 day sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen Antone Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Allen Antone Johnson in court in custody with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deft pleads No Contest freely and voluntarily; Court accepts plea and finds Deft Guilty; Court orders: 51 days RCJail w/Huber, $443 costs due forthwith--9 days Jail in lieu of costs, Consecutive to 51 days. 0 days credit.

Defendant Allen Antone Johnson in court in custody with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Allen Antone Johnson in court in custody with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant Allen Antone Johnson in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Anne Theresa Nack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calendar call scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Attorney Ellen Denise Craker in court.  Mark M. Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calendar call scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Allen Antone Johnson in court in custody with attorney Kelly James Mattingly.  Gwanny J Tjoa appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.    Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court, jury trial to be set.
